subject: RE: [junit] Re: println => out of memory
msgSnippet: ... FWIW, I ve often run into the same problem.  It s definitely irritating. I also vaguely recall some ant bug related to this on Windows that was fixed in a
messageBody:
> > JUnit does this? Or ant's <junit> task does this?
>
> Ooops, this actually looks like ant's fault. (/me shifts blame).

FWIW, I've often run into the same problem. It's definitely irritating.
I also vaguely recall some ant bug related to this on Windows that was
fixed in a fairly recent (last 8 or 10 months) version of ant.


Todd.
